# Queen Regent's Prerogative Act 1554

|type=Act
|parliament=Parliament of England
|long_title=An Acte declaring that the Regall Power of this Realme is in the Quenes Majestie as fully and absolutely as ever it was in any of her moste noble Progenitours Kinges of this Realme.
|year=1553
|citation=1 Mar. Sess. 3 c. 1
|territorial_extent=England and Wales
|royal_assent=5 May 1554
|commencement=2 April 1554
|repeal_date= 1 January 1970
|amendments=
|related_legislation=
|repealing_legislation=Statute Law (Repeals) Act 1969
|status=Repealed
|original_text=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id=pst.000017915519&seq=310
|}}
The '''Queen Regent's Prerogative Act 1554''' (1 Mar. Sess. 3 c. 1) was an act of the Parliament of England.
Subsequent developments
The whole act was repealed by section 1 of, and part I of the [http://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/1969/52/schedule schedule] to, the Statute Law (Repeals) Act 1969.
Notes
References
*Halsbury's Statutes,
